title: What's a good book?: selecting books for children
creator_credit: Joanna Foster and Weston Woods Studios
brief_description: Various librarians and writers give their opinions as to what constitutes good reading material for children. Shows the decision-making process behind the selection of books for children’s libraries and stresses the need to consider why children like particular books. Suitable for tertiary/teacher level.
